Class Engine

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      Engine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public final class Engine
extends java.lang.Thread

This the Game Engine.

It handles most operations that are performed during run time. It does both number processing and calculations as well as GameObject movement and World handling.

Since:
May 8, 2011
Version:
1.0.0.12 May 8, 2011
Author:
Mihail Kurbako, Dan Zapornicov

Constructor Detail

Engine

public Engine(World<GameObject> world)
This constructs a new instance of the Engine Object. Engine, subclass of java.lang.Thread, runs in a Thread separate from the main program, and creates 2 sub Threads of its own, that it partially handles. This class is responsible for Object movement and Physics.

Parameters:
world - The World Object that GameObjects are stored within that this will manage.
Method Detail

recalculateMovement

public void recalculateMovement()
This method does numeric calculations for all Movable GameObjects within the handled World. This method handles magnetism calculations for all Movables.

handleMovement

public void handleMovement()
This method handles GameObject movement in the handled World. This is movement for all GameObjects that implement Movable. Other Object are not hgandled by this method as they cannot move therefore need not be processed by this game.

setWorld

public void setWorld(World<GameObject> world)
Sets the World Object that this engine processes.

Parameters:
world - The value for the World Object.

getWorld

public World<GameObject> getWorld()
Returns the World Object that this Engine handles.

Returns:
The World Object.

canMoveObject

public boolean canMoveObject(GameObject go,
                             int x,
                             int y)
Checks whether a given GameObject can move to given coordinates.

Parameters:
go - The GameObject in question.
x - The X coordinate in question.
y - The Y coordinate in question.
Returns:
true if able, false otherwise.

performMove

public void performMove(GameObject go,
                        int x,
                        int y)
Moves a GameObject to a given location in the World.

Parameters:
go - The GameObject in question.
x - The X coordinate to be moved to.
y - The Y coordinate to be moved to.

notifyMoveCalculator

public void notifyMoveCalculator()
This method is called by the MoveManager Thread from the context of the Engine class to prevent IllegalAccessExceptions. It is used to notify the MoveCalculator Thread that it may stop waiting and resume its functionality as normal.

See Also:
MoveCalculator, MoveManager

notifyMoveManager

public void notifyMoveManager()
This method is called by the MoveCalculator Thread from the context of the Engine class to prevent IllegalAccessExceptions. It is used to notify the MoveManager Thread that it may stop waiting and resume its functionality as normal.

See Also:
MoveCalculator, MoveManager

run

public void run()
The run method inherited from Thread. It was overridden for the use in this class. This method performs the following: First, it creates instances of both the MoveCalculator and MoveManager Objects (both are subclasses of java.lang.Thread and therefore run in Threads). Once the Objects have been instantiated, it invokes the start() method which causes their appropriate run methods to be invoked in separate Threads. After this point it simply monitors and manages the Threads. The Threads are self and mutually maintained by each other, and are capable of continuously running and managing each other until stop conditions are met.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
See Also:
MoveCalculator, MoveManager, Thread
